data.title: Increase upper limit for decoded audio
data.body:
According to [this part in the docs](https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/nightlies/docs/api/com/badlogic/gdx/Audio.html#newSound-com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle-) "current upper limit for decoded audio is 1 MB." This seems quite low. Especially on the desktop.

Is there limit for how many sounds can be played at the same time?

data.title: Weird behaviour with pixmap colors (alpha)
Back button on android not being catched by Gdx.input.isKeyJustPressed()
data.body:
As I said in the description of this issue, the back button on android device is not being catched by Gdx.input.isKeyJustPressed(). Instead, Gdx.input.isKeyPressed() works fine. Of course, I do Gdx.input.setCatchBackKey(true) before so that is not the problem.
I found another guy confirming this issue here:
http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/104311/libgdx-why-doesnt-gdx-input-iskeyjustpressed-work
He also provides sample code how to reproduce the problem.

data.title: Fixes #4164, adds FilterableVehicleRaycaster
data.body:
Fixes #4164. Adds a new `FilterableVehicleRaycaster` C/C++ class to the custom Bullet wrapper classes and a generated Java class by adding it to the `dynamics.i` interface file.

Includes a test/demo called `VehicleFilterTest` which extends the existing `VehicleTest`.

The wrapper code compiles on the Linux and Android platform (Windows and OSX is untested). In order to compile for Android we had to run the `BulletBuild.java` program, which regenerated a file called `Android.mk`. Presumably the automated build system will do this, otherwise we can add it to the PR.

The demo has been tested on desktop, but we were unable to test on Android because of problems when packaging the Bullet libraries. Neither has it been tested on the other platforms. If someone else could test on Android and the other platforms it would be great.

data.title: BoundingBox in 2d
SpriteBatch: IllegalArgumentException with OpenGL ES 3.0 in OS X
data.body:
#### Issue details

I'm trying to run a plain project with OpenGL ES 3.0 enabled. When I try to create a SpriteBatch, the program crashes with IllegalArgumentException. This only seems to happen on OS X; the code runs fine on Arch Linux. It seems to be caused by the default shader.
#### Reproduction steps/code
1. Enable OpenGL ES 3.0 by setting `config.useGL30 = true`
2. Create a SpriteBatch with default constructor
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

Tested with 1.9.3 and 1.9.4, both crash
#### Stacktrace

``` java
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error compiling shader: ERROR: 0:1: '' :  #version required and missing.
ERROR: 0:1: 'attribute' : syntax error: syntax error
ERROR: 0:1: '' :  #version required and missing.
ERROR: 0:7: 'varying' : syntax error: syntax error

    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch.createDefaultShader(SpriteBatch.java:160)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch.<init>(SpriteBatch.java:123)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch.<init>(SpriteBatch.java:78)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage.<init>(Stage.java:100)
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [X] MacOS

data.title: Camera now uses correct viewport height value for unproject
data.body:
There is a bug in `Camera#unproject(Vector3, int, int, int, int)` code, it has viewport height as fifth argument, but still uses `Gdx.graphics.getHeight()` for that value. As result, it gives wrong point translation result (Y component is messed up) in case when actual GL viewport and application window size are different.

This PR is partially related to https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/3175

data.title: A clean test app won't launch due to LwjglGraphics.createDisplayPixelFormat error
data.body:
I just installed created a fresh libgdx application via the generator found on the official web site. I left practically all things at default. Once generated, I imported the project in eclipse using Gradle (as explained in the official procedure). Upon trying to launch my application on desktop, I get the following error:

Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.createDisplayPixelFormat(LwjglGraphics.java:322)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.setupDisplay(LwjglGraphics.java:216)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:142)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:124)

Under "Project and External Dependencies" I can see it links to libgdx 1.9.4 and lwjgl 2.9.2 (by the way, why isn't libgdx using lwjgl 2.9.3, which is the latest version?) and some other non-important stuff.

Note that this is a fresh project generated by the "Libgdx Project Generator" - I haven't modified a thing!

I'm running Windows 10 on HP Elitebook 8560p (it's a laptop) and it has Intel HD Graphics 3000 (which is Microsoft DirectX 10.1 (Shader Model 4.1) and OpenGL 3.0 capable).

If you require any more info, please tell.

data.title: MOE Link third party framework error!
data.body:
I use the moe actions to link framework.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2835129/19235735/22c69b92-8f26-11e6-8f47-25165b7337dc.png)

And the moe plugin will rebuild the xcode file and add some dependencies into the .xcconfig file. For example the admob framework, should add `AdSupport,AudioToolbox,AVFoundation,CoreBluetooth,CoreGraphics,CoreMedia,CoreMotion,CoreTelephony,CoreVideo,EventKit,EventKitUI,Foundation,GLKit,MediaPlayer,MessageUI,OpenGLES,SafariServices,StoreKit,SystemConfiguration,UIKit`to the xcconfig file.

But the setup.jar set the generateProject false,  so I have to add dependencies manually. Can you please make the 'generateProject true' so that the moe plugin can automatically add dependencies by rebuild the xcode project file.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

libgdx 1.9.5-SNAPSHOT
moe-gradle:1.2.0
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] iOS (MOE)

JNIGen: NPE when having JNI section without any native method
data.body:
#### Issue details

NullPointerException occurs when JNI section is declared without any native method in tihe same class that JNI section is.
Probably as cMethodParser.parse(headerFileContent) can't find any JNIEXPORT returns null and .getMethods() is called with null result causing NPE
#### Reproduction steps/code

Create a java file with and pass the JNIGen:
public class Example {
    /*JNI
    static jint example = 0;
     */
}
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

JNIGen 1.9.4
#### Stacktrace

``` java
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.generateCppFile(NativeCodeGenerator.java:304)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.processDirectory(NativeCodeGenerator.java:267)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.processDirectory(NativeCodeGenerator.java:245)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.processDirectory(NativeCodeGenerator.java:245)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.processDirectory(NativeCodeGenerator.java:245)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.generate(NativeCodeGenerator.java:236)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.jnigen.NativeCodeGenerator.generate(NativeCodeGenerator.java:202)
```

data.title: libEGL warning: failed to create a pipe screen for i965
data.body:
#### Issue details

One of my users has [reported an error](https://github.com/raeleus/skin-composer/issues/11) under Ubuntu Linux when running any LibGDX app using the LWJGL3 backend: `libEGL warning: failed to create a pipe screen for i965` I can't reproduce the issue under Ubuntu or Linux Mint, so I imagine it is specific to Intel processors or his particular hardware setup. The Window decorations render, however the game screen does not display and instead shows something of a snapshot of what was underneath the window. He's tested with a basic app that only renders a skin and it still reproduces the issue.

After doing some research, I found the following documented LWJGL3 issue: https://github.com/LWJGL/lwjgl3/issues/205 which sounds exactly like what this user was experiencing. The page speaks of a fix or partial workaround. Can this be applied to LibGDX? Thanks for your time.
#### Reproduction steps/code

Any project that implements the LWJGL3 backend and run under Ubuntu Linux on certain hardware configurations. An example jar here: https://github.com/raeleus/skin-composer/files/509721/Quantum.Horizon.zip
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

_1.9.4 and 1.9.5-SNAPSHOT_
#### Stacktrace

``` java
java -jar skin_composer.jar
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.lwjgl.system.APIUtil.apiGetManifestValue(APIUtil.java:97)
at org.lwjgl.system.Library.checkHash(Library.java:260)
at org.lwjgl.system.Library.(Library.java:44)
at org.lwjgl.system.MemoryAccess.(MemoryAccess.java:17)
at org.lwjgl.system.ThreadLocalUtil$UnsafeState.(ThreadLocalUtil.java:86)
at org.lwjgl.system.ThreadLocalUtil.getInstance(ThreadLocalUtil.java:43)
at org.lwjgl.system.ThreadLocalUtil.(ThreadLocalUtil.java:20)
at org.lwjgl.system.MemoryStack.stackPush(MemoryStack.java:577)
at org.lwjgl.system.Callback.(Callback.java:35)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.initializeGlfw(Lwjgl3Application.java:78)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.(Lwjgl3Application.java:87)
at com.ray3k.skincomposer.desktop.DesktopLauncher.main(DesktopLauncher.java:42)
libEGL warning: failed to create a pipe screen for i965
Cannot connect to server socket err = No such file or directory
Cannot connect to server request channel
jack server is not running or cannot be started
```
#### Affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Since 1.9.4 font scale no longer effects size of scene2d label
Add methods to calculate average for all numeric data types
TexturePacker$Settings now correctly copies array fields from another instance
data.body: `TexturePacker$Settings#set(Settings)` used to copy array fields by reference. Now it creates new arrays for own fields.

data.title: Android Plugin for Gradle doesn't play nice with the current libGDX source
data.body:
#### Issue details

As previously discussed in issue #4230, starting with version 1.3 the Android Plugin for Gradle doesn't like a module and it's parent sharing the same name. You end up with an error message when trying to do a Gradle Sync or to build and run the Android project from within the IDE.

In both Android Studio and IntelliJ IDEA, you get the following error:

``` java
Error:(23, 1) A problem occurred evaluating project ':tests:gdx-tests-android'.
> Failed to apply plugin [id 'com.android.application']
   > Your project contains 2 or more modules with the same identification com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d
at ":extensions:gdx-box2d" and ":extensions:gdx-box2d:gdx-box2d".
You must use different identification (either name or group) for each modules.
```

That part is easy enough to fix. All you need to do is to rename the parent "module".  I have already done this part in commit 50179d2a870c1c938d5a0c5014b9c0a09fc3c4d7 on my fork. Up until a few days ago it was enough to get the code to Sync and Run nicely in the IDE. (I even submitted PR #4316 to that effect.)

Unfortunately, with the refactoring of the Gradle build (0ea025084f59d8feb7711f825bf0f11c440830bd) the Gradle Sync and Instant Run within the IDE are no longer working even with this fix.

We're now left with the following error:

``` java
Error:(18, 1) A problem occurred evaluating project ':tests:gdx-tests'.
> Could not find method compile() for arguments [project ':gdx'] on object of type org.gradle.api.internal.artifacts.dsl.dependencies.DefaultDependencyHandler.
```

Interestingly, the command-line Grade build and installDebug do work without a hitch. It would appear that the Android plugin get confused with the dependencies. Manually adding `apply plugin: "java"` to the `gradle.build` file of `:tests:gdx-tests` will allow the build to proceed further but even when adding it to all the related modules, other errors crop up further along so it's not a viable solution and I had to admit defeat due to my limited knowledge of Gradle.

data.title: [backend-lwjgl3] setInitialBackgroundColor has no effect
data.body:
#### Issue details

For the LWJGL3 backend, changing initialBackgroundColor in the Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration has no effect

No mater what color i choose, the screen is still white

I tried the JGLFW backend, and it works fine
#### Reproduction steps/code

Choose the LWJGL3 backend, in your desktop module use this as config

``` kotlin
    val config = Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration()
    config.setWindowedMode(1440,900)
    config.setInitialBackgroundColor(Color.BLACK)
    Lwjgl3Application(TheRoguer(), config)
```
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

libGDX 1.9.5-SNAPSHOT
LWJGL3 Backend 1.9.5-SNAPSHOT
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows 10
- [x] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

 IllegalStateException: @NotNull method org/robovm/idea/running/RoboVmRunProfileState.startProcess must not return null
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

obovm-gradle-plugin:2.2.1-SNAPSHOT
